de.cocolab.reuse
Class General

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--de.cocolab.reuse.General
public class General
extends java.lang.Object

General functionality, static methods.

The routines here partly duplicate things found in the standard Java libraries. There are two reasons for this:

  • We sometimes need a tuned version of a routine for a particular purpose, for example exponential functions with integer arguments.
  • For compatibility with versions of Cocktail for other programming languages.

Version:
$Id: $

Field Detail

MaxAlign

public static final int MaxAlign
Maximum alignment. Performance on some architectures is sensitive to the alignment of blocks of memory being moved. MaxAlign is used to determine the best offset to use when reading in to a buffer. For an example and discussion see the rex skeleton.

public static int antiLog(int x)
Return number of lowest bit set in x.

Parameters:
x - An integer
Returns:
The number of the lowest bit set, for example antiLog(12) = 2
